intro: Perovskia pamirica, commonly known as the Pamir blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are often aromatic and slightly fuzzy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Perovskia pamirica is typically found in rocky or well-drained soils at high altitudes.
